Insight: XGBoost achieved the highest accuracy (87.87%) but was deleted from the repository
Recommendation: Consider restoring XGBoost or retraining for production use

Insight: Deep Neural Network shows the best balance of precision (79.9%) and recall (81.8%) with F1=0.809
Recommendation: DNN is suitable for current deployment but consider ensemble methods

Insight: Decision Tree offers highest interpretability but lowest accuracy (78.67%)
Recommendation: Keep a simple tree model for stakeholder explanations

Insight: Only DNN is currently active; all tree-based models were removed, limiting model comparison options
Recommendation: Restore deleted models for comprehensive comparison and ensemble options

Insight: K-Means clustering reveals 2 natural groups in both red and white wines with moderate silhouette scores (0.205-0.213)
Recommendation: Use clustering for customer segmentation and targeted marketing

Insight: Clusters show correlation with quality: Cluster 1 tends toward higher quality wines
Recommendation: Validate clustering patterns with domain experts in winemaking

Insight: Engineered features (acidity_ratio, alcohol_va_ratio, etc.) improved model performance
Recommendation: Continue feature engineering with domain knowledge

Insight: All models struggle with minority class (high-quality wines), indicating class imbalance
Recommendation: Implement SMOTE, class weights, or stratified sampling to address imbalance
